name: 4-methyl-2-pentanone production | 4-methyl-2-pentanone | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1083/documentation

This data represents the production of 1 kg of 4-methyl-2-pentanone via one-step hydrogenation of acetone.  Raw materials, auxilliaries, energy consumptions and emissions are modelled with data from US-production.  Infrastructure is included with a default value.

From the reception of acetone at the factory gate.

The activity ends with 1 kg of 4-methyl-2-pentanone, 100% at the factory gate.  The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: 4-Methyl-2-pentanone is produced in one step from acetone and hydrogen.;  For this process, a combination of a cation exchanger with palladium is generally used as a catalyst. The acetone is fed with hydrogen over the palladium-charged catalyst at 130 °C and 0.5 – 5.0 MPa. A selectivity of > 95 %  at a conversion of < 50 % is thereby attained. ;Reference:;Siegel, H., Eggersdörfer, M.: Ketons. In: Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Seventh Edition, 2004 Electronic Release (ed. Fiedler E., Grossmann G., Kersebohm D., Weiss G. and Witte C.). 7 th Electronic Release Edition. Wiley InterScience, New York, Online-Version under: http://www.mrw.interscience.wiley.com/ueic/articles/

exchanges.description:
4-Methyl-2-pentanone is a colorless liquid with a less pronounced ketone-like odor. The major application of 4-methyl-2-pentanone is as a solvent for vinyl, epoxy, and acrylic resins, for natural resins, and  for nitrocellulose. A further use is as a solvent for dyes in the printing industry. 

4-Methyl-2-pentanone is also a versatile  extracting agent, e.g., for the production of antibiotics, or the removal of paraffins from mineral oil for the production  of lubricating oils. The importance of 4-methyl-2-pentanone as an intermediate for synthesis is relatively low. The most important  product is 4-methyl-2-pentanol, obtained by hydrogenation of the ketone. 4-Methyl-2-pentanone peroxide has some importance as a polymerization initiator for ethylene and for the hardening of unsaturated polyester resins.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

flow.name: Isopropanol
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
Calculation.  This data was calculated from the amount of emissions in the treated waste water assuming a carbon conversion of 96% for COD and the worst case scenario: BOD=COD. 

It is assumed that the manufacturing plants are located in an urban/industrial area and consequently the emissions are categorized as emanating in a high population density area. The emissions into water are assumed to be emitted into rivers.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation.  Infrastructure is estimated based on the dataset "chemical plant, organics". This dataset assumes a built area of about 4.2 ha, an average output of 50'000 t/a, and plant life of fifty years. The estimated value is 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced chemical.
